author: Jessica
excerpt: More summer!! We had another fun (hot) week. Made cookies for the pool. And this salmon spread/dip/salad that I threw together with last Sunday’s grilled salmon on a whim. It was SO good. They are obsessed with swimming. Fun with friends! We hit the high 90s last week and it was rough. This was the […]
text: More summer!! We had another fun (hot) week. Made cookies for the pool. And this salmon spread/dip/salad that I threw together with last Sunday’s grilled salmon on a whim. It was SO good. They are obsessed with swimming. Fun with friends! We hit the high 90s last week and it was rough. This was the only thing to do. I made these amazing quick steak salads last week. The recipe/method was in this week’s substack. Grilled garlic bread. Can’t heat up the house! She worked on this paint by number canvas for HOURS one day. It turned out amazing. Also her little hair turning bright blonde again is just too cute. She also had tennis camp all week! He enjoyed it. Monkey bars are harder when you can touch the ground!! Love. Biggest cheerleader. Summer hockey! Jordan had a hair cut appt and she has a bunny and HE LOVES IT. I did a super fun event at a local bakery space! Aperol spritz after. And garlic bread. Baby ducks on our morning walk. Last day of tennis camp! Playground fun. We played so many different card games during a thunderstorm. Cross country started too!!!! This might be her fall sport for good! Even Max ran with a smile on his face. Sibling love at lunch. They have been obsessed with each other this summer and it’s so cute. Playing so many things together. Baby boy!! I love a 10.5 year old who still colors. The best pizza. Hot honey forever! Jeni’s after. We tried the new toasted s’mores and it was good but definitely tasted like coffee! Jordan begged Eddie to go to the park. He saw baby ducks too! Then Eddie just casually freehanded this Bluey chalk art in minutes. He is SO talented at art. I made Eddie’s favorite pancakes. And it was another swim day. I need stock in leave-in conditioner this year!!
html:
More summer!!

We had another fun (hot) week.

Made cookies for the pool.

And this salmon spread/dip/salad that I threw together with last Sunday’s grilled salmon on a whim. It was SO good.

They are obsessed with swimming.

Fun with friends!

We hit the high 90s last week and it was rough.

This was the only thing to do.

I made these amazing quick steak salads last week. The recipe/method was in this week’s substack.

Grilled garlic bread. Can’t heat up the house!

She worked on this paint by number canvas for HOURS one day.

It turned out amazing.

Also her little hair turning bright blonde again is just too cute.

She also had tennis camp all week!

He enjoyed it.

Monkey bars are harder when you can touch the ground!!

Love.

Biggest cheerleader.

Summer hockey!

Jordan had a hair cut appt and she has a bunny and HE LOVES IT.

I did a super fun event at a local bakery space! Aperol spritz after.

And garlic bread.

Baby ducks on our morning walk.

Last day of tennis camp!

Playground fun.

We played so many different card games during a thunderstorm.

Cross country started too!!!!

This might be her fall sport for good!

Even Max ran with a smile on his face.

Sibling love at lunch.

They have been obsessed with each other this summer and it’s so cute. Playing so many things together.

Baby boy!!

I love a 10.5 year old who still colors.

The best pizza.

Hot honey forever!

Jeni’s after. We tried the new toasted s’mores and it was good but definitely tasted like coffee!

Jordan begged Eddie to go to the park.

He saw baby ducks too!

Then Eddie just casually freehanded this Bluey chalk art in minutes. He is SO talented at art.

I made Eddie’s favorite pancakes.

And it was another swim day. I need stock in leave-in conditioner this year!!
